column4: to upgrade to 10.10 must i do aclean install or is there a way to upgrade from lucid without losing all the software?
After it's released, ubuntu should prompt you to update. If not, use 'gksu update-manager -d'
so the upgrade from lucid does not require reinstalling the os, i can upgrade directly from the update manager?
Yes, you can upgrade without clean installing. This usually works if you haven't made any modifications to your system
If you have added packages, have any strange bugs or other things going on, you should do a clean install
To avoid headaches and problems
so the new 10.10 is basically a refined version of lucid? or is it likley to have lots of issues because the developers were rushed to meet their deadline or somthing like that?
I am a hobbyist developer and help wherever I can

No. The way Linux works is, there is a kernel and GNU apps developed constantly all the time upstream, as well as the multitude of other software that runs on linux. Every 6 months, ubuntu and other major distributions make a release which takes all of this code and they try to make the most stable system while still providing latest code and features
Sometimes there are occasional bugs and regressions but that just comes with the Linux. No one can possibly catch every single bug or problem.
The common goal is to improve software, support new hardware and eliminate bugs
HP hardware had lots of sound issues with lucid. is that likly to be fixed?
I have no idea.
You would have to grab a live cd and test it. But the common goal is to make it better and you can help by filing a bug report about any issue you're having
i take it that you are one of the developers?
I work on the compiz project a lot. but not a 'ubuntu dev'

aaah good, because i think that it is compiz that somtimes does not give the windows a menu bar(with the x, square, and underscore to minimize)...perhaps you could tell me how to fix that or will it not be an issue with 10.10
That is a bug that has been a common issue with ubuntu 10.04. My theory is they start compiz too fast before X or the drivers are ready
There's a lot of things you can do to try and workaround it but I really hope it's fixed in 10.10 (I would expect nothing less)
is ther a patch or somthing that fixes it?
No, it's just a trial and error diagnoses you have to do in order to try and figure out the real problem. The fact is that it is a ubuntu bug and not a problem with compiz though
